directors.bio: Quinn's 15 years of experience in the ad industry has given him a firm understanding of the business, from the perspective of both client and agency, and it’s why he insists on a collaborative process. Emotive storytelling, filled with heart and artistry is what best defines his output. There’s a sincerity baked into the tone of Quinn’s work. Whether he’s setting out to make you laugh, cry or buy - you’re going to feel it.
directors.name: David Quinn
awards: Straight8 Industry ShoutOut Cannes, Audience Choice Award, 2018
Shots, Young Director Award, 2014

directors.bio: Dugan Gundelfinger is not your conventional director. Fresh off the release of his award-winning short, *Heroic Dose* (to much internet-acclaim, BTW) *,* he also just dropped a full-length album of psychedelic-dadcore entitled ‘infinity casual’. Right. His comedic sensibilities lend themselves to a tone that’s consistently warm, friendly and outlandish. And he’s used these sensibilities to helm campaigns for Bud Light, Hims, and Dominos. Oh, and also, his work has been recognized at the Grammy Awards and The Clios.
directors.name: Dugan Gundelfinger
awards: Grammy Awards, Best Music Video Nomination, 2011
Clio Music, Bronze Award, 2024

directors.bio: Isaacc Ravishankara is a technically sound filmmaker. His work is methodical, and painstakingly detailed. His use of camera language, blocking and choreography are tools he’s sharpened with films for Finneas, Samsung and LA Tourism. A deep believer that art can be a force that drives society forward, Isaac co-founded OMG Everywhere, a non-profit that provides free film and music workshops for kids in LA, NY, Oakland and London.
directors.name: Isaac Ravishankara
awards: Booooooom TV Awards, Runner-Up, 2019
Clio Awards, Silver, 2017
Burbank International Film Festival, Best Short Film Nomination, 2014

directors.bio: Ismael is one of the industry’s leading figures. A master of his craft, with a keen eye for detail, his signature work consistently stands out from the crowd and breaks the mold. As one of the godfathers of emotional storytelling in the commercial scene, he brings a wealth of experience and versatility and is always able to create something beautiful with a rough edge – no matter the brief or genre. His motto? “We only have one chance to do this, so we better do it right!”
directors.name: Ismael
awards: Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity, Award
Epica Awards, Award
ADC Europe Awards, Award
Dutch Creativity Awards (ADCN Awards), Award

directors.bio: Jackie started out as a writer working in the creative department - the experience armed him with an inside perspective on directing commercial work. His background informs his understanding of dialogue, pace and performance, and results in work that is irreverent and offbeat. Jackie strives for a visual approach that balances colourful imagery, with dialogue-driven comedy. (If, of course, the agency can afford sound.)
directors.name: Jackie Abraham
awards: Young Director Award, Young Director Award (Comedy), 2024, “Nine to Five 1995”

directors.bio: Emotive. Visceral. Compelling. All descriptors attributed to the work of James Lawes. With an ability to get strong performances from both actors and non-actors alike. His style mixes the authentic with the otherworldly. Using a distinctive mix of in-camera visual effects and post production VFX, as well as a thoughtful approach to his photography, he mines out work that makes the audience question why they didn’t think of that.
directors.name: James Lawes
awards: The Drum Roses, Silver, Best Commercial ‘A Little Bit’ Scottish Government, 2021
EvCom, Gold, Best Health and Safety Film ‘Look Up, Look Out’ ENA, 2020
New York Festival, Gold ‘Look Up, Look Out’ ENA, 2020
British Horror Film Festival, Best Director ‘Be Good’, 2019
Misty Moon International Film Festival, Judges Award ‘Be Good’, 2019
Misty Moon International Film Festival, Audience Award ‘Be Good’, 2019
Misty Moon International Film Festival, Fenella Fielding Award ‘Be Good’, 2019
Cannes Media, Silver, Best Informational ‘The Accident’ ENA, 2019
EvCom, Silver, Best Health and Safety Film ‘Home in One Piece’ Infineum, 2019
New York Film Festival, Gold, Best Event Film ‘Graffiti’ McDonalds, 2019
New York Film Festival, Bronze, Best Visual Effects ‘Graffiti’ McDonalds, 2019
Brand Film Festival, Bronze, Best Non-Profit ‘Graffiti’ McDonalds, 2019

directors.bio: Jeremi has exquisite taste. As he should. Hailing from Paris with a  background in design-fiction means he knows what it takes to create a world and make the audience invest in what’s going on within it. His penchant for aesthetics comes through in every frame, and this is showcased in his collaborations with Levi’s, Travis Scott and Roger Federer. He’s got great hair, and try though as he might, he still cannot understand the people from Quebec.
directors.name: Jeremi Durand
awards: LIA Winner GOLD x2 for Best Direction & Best Cinematography
1.4 Winner GOLD 2025 Shortlists for Best MV & Best Commercial x4
D&AD Shortlist for Best Direction in Commercials 2025
UKMVAs Best Rock Video
BMVAs Shortlists x7
WEBBY Best MV 2023
Shark Awards Shortlists x3
Club Des D.A (ADC) Winner BRONZE & Shortlists x2
EyeCandy Shortlist Director Of The Year 2024
Berlin Commercial Shortlists x7
YDA Winner SILVER for Best MV 2024
Shiny Awards Winner GOLD for Best MV
Creative Circle Winner GOLD for Best Director 2025
Promonews Director of the Year Shortlist 2024
Creativepool Winner Director of the Year 2025
LE BOOK Winner GOLD 2025.

directors.bio: With appearances at SXSW, Sundance, and Cannes Lions - PLUS front wo-manning a band called Number One Popstar, Kate Hollowell is a true multi-hyphenate. Her extensive body of work displays a signature blend of irreverent, heartfelt comedy, and her approach to conceptual thinking is truly stand- out. (Uhm, her best friend dies and gets reincarnated as a toilet, yeah.) She’s currently slated to direct a feature film with AMBLIN Entertainment, and it will most likely, probably, be good.
directors.name: Kate Hollowell
awards: Sundance Film Festival, Short Film Jury Award for U.S. Fiction, 2024
HollyShorts Film Festival, Best Director Award, 2024
Young Director Award, Shortlisted for Commercial Category for “How She Rolls”, 2023

directors.bio: Kevin Castanheira is a dynamic director whose work bridges the worlds of art, fashion, and culture. Globally recognized and LA based, Kevin's work is highly visual with a key focus on story and style. He's won several awards including Shots Ad of the Year, Webbys, and Boooooooom Best Doc of the year.
directors.name: Kevin Castanheira

directors.bio:
Leo is a director’s director. A gifted eye, he can find a frame anywhere. His background as a photographer results in imagery that is arresting, emotive and thought provoking. 

From automotive to financial to athletics, he’s the guy you call when you need to put a helicopter on top of a mountain (or Tiger Woods on the putting green). Technically sound, with a firm grip on the language of light, he’s a visual storyteller that gets the audience to lean in. Every time.
directors.name: Leo Zuckerman
awards: Vimeo, Staff Picks, 2013
Canadian Tourism Commission, Award for “Dear Mum” Campaign

directors.bio: Starting out on the agency side as an Art Director armed Mapp with a strong understanding of the creative department’s process, as well as the methodology behind visual storytelling. He takes a  playful, ‘out of the box’ approach to his comedy. Whether it’s practical in-camera effects or outlandish VFX work, his spots, complemented by cheeky performance and thoughtful casting, make it easy to crack a smile.
directors.name: Mapp
awards: Cannes Lions International Festival of Creativity, Grand Prix for IKEA “Lamp” Commercial
Clio Awards, Grand Clio for IKEA
Anvil Awards, Winner for PlayAlberta Campaign, 2023
Creative Marketing Awards, Winner for PlayAlberta Campaign, 2023
Effie Awards, 3x Winner for PlayAlberta Campaign, 2023
Ciclope, Gold Winner for Work with Peelz, 2022
Anvil Awards, Winner for Western Canada Lottery Campaign, 2021
Anvil Awards, Winner for Western Canada Lottery Campaign, 2020
Clio Awards, Winner for The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel/Amazon Prime Video, 2019
Marketing Dive Awards, Campaign of the Year, Amazon x Jurassic World, 2018
The One Show, Automobile Advertising of the Year Awards, Recognized for Work with MINI, 2015

directors.name: Mark Gilbert
directors.bio: Mark Gilbert is an incredible comedic commercial director and cinematic storyteller, recognized for his precise command of casting, performance, and comedic narrative — often regarded as an “actor’s director” who elevates scripts through nuance, tone, and restraint. His work pairs strong visual storytelling with emotional intelligence, resulting in films that feel sharp, culturally relevant, and intentionally crafted for today’s market. From the iconic IKEA “Start the Car” spot that became a cultural touchstone in Canada, to BMW’s “Twins,” the Cannes Lion–winning “Ladyballs” for Ovarian Cancer Canada, and the refreshingly restrained “No Jingles or Mascots” campaign, Mark consistently delivers comedy that is smart, cinematic, and purpose-driven. With a foundation in award-winning photography and editorial storytelling, his performance-first approach has earned international recognition from Cannes, D&AD, CLIOs, ANDYs, and Saatchi & Saatchi’s New Directors Showcase, cementing his voice as a confident, modern force in relevant comedic commercial storytelling.

Matt has a knack for putting the camera in interesting places, and using it to make the audience feel things. He tackles his subject matter, from the lighthearted to the marginalized, with a sensitivity that he executes with class and character. His work can be warm, informative and provocative. Sometimes all at once. (That’s called versatility BTW.)
directors.name: Matt Rhodes
awards: D&AD Awards, Best Performance, 2022
Kinsale Shark Awards, Best Performance, 2022
Kinsale Shark Awards, Winner of Over 40 Awards
Promax Awards, Winner of Over 40 Awards

directors.bio:
Nicolas Heller successfully blurs the line between content creator and commercial director, which at present date, is a huge plus. The work he’s done on his platform has given him the tools to tell compelling stories in the digital age. With over 3 million social media followers flocking to his page (@newyorknico) for daily updates on everything New York, Nico knows exactly how to capture personality, no matter what lens he’s using. 

He’s been showcased in The New York Times, awarded at the Clios, and honoured by President Biden with the Lifetime Achievement Award.
directors.name: New York Nico
awards: CLIO Awards: Heller has won his first CLIO Awards, acknowledging his excellence in advertising and creative work.
President's Lifetime Achievement Award: In 2021, President Joe Biden recognized Heller's work by presenting him with this prestigious award, honoring his significant contributions to the community.
Publications: Heller's work and influence have been featured in various publications, including a profile in PRINT Magazine's “Design Matters” podcast.

directors.bio: Nikki is what one could call, prodigious. She has a gifted eye for capturing her subjects’ softer sides, and this brings an honest energy and lightheartedness to her work, one most directors only achieve after years of experience. With a solid understanding of portraiture, she has helmed campaigns for Nike, and GARAGE, and has been recognized by Applied Arts Magazine..
directors.name: Nikki Ross
awards: Applied Arts Magazine, The Maker of Men, 2024, for Nikki Ross
The Kit, Best Dressed Canadians, 2024, for Nikki Ross

directors.bio: Sarner has the ability to capture everyday life with an elevated perspective. In other words, it feels like you’ve seen it before, but it looks beautiful. Whether it’s a first-time performer, or a seasoned celebrity talent, he mines authentic performances out of his talent. Nuanced and heartfelt, his work leaves a lasting impression — the mark of an emotive storyteller.
directors.name: Nolan Sarner
awards: Canadian Screen Award Winner, 2018
Canadian Screen Award Nominee, 2019
ADCC, Shortlist, 2024
Berlin Commercial Awards, Shortlist, 2021 & 2022
Vimeo, Staff Pick
1.4 Shortlist, 2025
YDA Shortlist, 2025 - Results Still Pending

directors.bio: Renée is one of those increasingly rare talents working in the space, in that she was classically trained. A graduate of NYU Tisch School of The Arts, her work speaks to her process, and exemplifies her as a methodical and thought provoking story teller. With work for Johnnie Walker, Facebook and The Huffington Post under her belt, she can convey a message no matter what the tone might be.
directors.name: Renée Mao
awards: AACTA Awards, Best Digital Series, 2022
Vimeo, Staff Picks
Webby Awards, Honoree, 2020

directors.bio: How can anyone this nice devote so much attention to detail? Rob Fiocca, arguably Canada’s best food director, has an eye for beauty that is unparalleled. He consistently raises the bar for how we shoot food in this country. With a firm command on light, texture and motion, he brings an avant-garde approach to the table-top space. His innovative take on styling and camera language, leave the audience satiating not just in the food he’s selling, but the choices he’s making.
directors.name: Rob Fiocca
awards: International ANDY Awards, Printed Materials Gold, 2016
Kinsale Sharks Awards, Design Bronze Winner, 2015
Kinsale Sharks Awards, Design Bronze Winner, 2015
LIA (London International Awards), Design Gold Winner, 2015
LIA (London International Awards), Design Gold Winner, 2015
Applied Arts Magazine, Award Winner, 2008
Graphis Photography Annual, Inclusion, 2008
International Photography Awards, Award Winner, 2007

directors.bio: Rodney has a filmic aesthetic, and it’s perfect for the types of stories he sets out to tell. It’s gritty, real, and showcases a high level of sensitivity, thought, and emotional depth - a welcome refresh in the ad space. His work for Nike, Under Armour and HULU all bear the touch of his compelling visual signature (grainy imperfections juxtaposed with everyday beauty). His filmwork has also been recognized at Tribeca, the Webby’s and Cannes.
directors.name: Rodney Lucas
awards: Tribeca Film Festival, Official Selection, 2024
Tribeca X Award, Best Episodic, 2021
Webby Award, Best Diversity & Inclusion, 2021
Telly Awards, 13 awards including four bronze, four silver, and three gold, 2021
AdStar Awards, Three awards, 2021
Cannes Lions, Shortlist recognition, 2021

directors.bio: Sam was born and raised within the walls of Skin & Bones. A treatment designer and image puller for the entirety of its roster, Sam learned the craft from the inside out, following directors from the brief to post production. His extensive knowledge of the industry and its processes, has informed his sensibilities and birthed a fledgling talent. He has steered campaign work for clients big and small, from KFC to local brands like the East Room and Linny’s.
directors.name: Sam Hughes

directors.bio: Sebastian hails from Australia where he cut his teeth making short films and music videos. He takes an inherently artistic approach to his work - vibrant colour palettes, dynamic camera language, and standout casting, he does not go with the expected choice, and it shows. His work has been recognized by Young Guns, SHOTS and the 1.4 Awards. His latest, ‘Family’ just took home the Gold Lion in the Young Director category in Cannes.
directors.name: Sebastian Hill-Esbrand
awards: Young Director Award, Gold Screen, 2022
Shots Awards, Recognition, 2022
Director's Notes, Recognition, Year 2022
1.4 Awards, Recognition, 2022
Young Guns 20, Finalist, 2022

directors.bio: Shawn started as a cinematographer. This is rare. It gives him a technical understanding of the frame most directors need a cinematographer for. Throw in his penchant for comedic tone, and you’ve got something different. And in a world of people reviewing food items in their cars and GRWM videos, different is good. His signature stems from creating a heightened world whereby grounded, nuanced performances can play. He’s built these worlds for the likes of XBOX, TD Bank and Dell computers.
directors.name: Shawn Zeytinoglu
awards: Tool of NA, Featured Director
Sterntag Film, Featured Director
LBBOnline, Profiled Director, Year 2024
Promo! Awards, Bronze, Best New Product Launch, 2015, for Audi – A3 Launch

directors.bio: Stuart’s choices revolve around using dynamic photography to tell highly emotive stories. This is a director who uses the tools at his disposal to yield a sensory experience. You quite literally feel his work. Whether it’s light, casting or score, everything is intentional, and serves the story he’s telling. And these are often difficult ones to tell. Stuart tackles sensitive subject matter - heartfelt, and at times, like life itself, dark. But Stuart does so with taste, never veering into tone deaf territory. He threads the needle with restraint and poise. His work has been recognized by The New York Times, The Webby’s, 1.4 Awards and SHOTS.
directors.name: Stuart Langfield
awards: OFFF, Speaker, 2022
1.4 Awards, Silver Medalist
Berlin Commercial, Shortlist
Shots, Featured
Webby, Honoree
Vimeo, Staff Pick
Leo Awards, 7 Nominations (1 win)
Boston Sci-Fi Festival, Award
Philip K. Dick Festival, Award
Boooooom, Feature
IFLScience, Feature
NY Times, Feature

about-bio: Skin and Bones is an award-winning director-representation and production company that calls Toronto, Canada home. We started in 2015 with art in our hearts, business on our minds and a simple goal — help young Canadian directing talent find their voice and grow. Ten years later our directors have grown up and so have we. Skin and Bones exists now as a powerhouse of creativity and craft. We have developed a roster of incredible directors and a network of talented affiliates and partners around the world. Female-owned, we believe the best work is made through real, honest collaboration and frequent high fives.

news.title: Our New Identity
news.body: We’re getting rid of the old Skin & Bones and starting fresh. It’s more than just a new look (but we love the new look), it’s a new way forward. Give the rebrand a spin on our site.

news.title: David Reviews
news.body: Always a good day when one of our favourite directors gets a five-star review. “People Watching” Stuart Mcintyre’s gorgeous and artful music video for Sam Fender gets top marks from team at David Reviews check it out [here](https://www.davidreviews.com/Reviews/2025/Sam_Fender_People_Watching/).

news.title: New Bathroom Wallpaper
news.body: We want to make sure everyone who comes to the office has the best experience, no matter what room they are in. That’s why we’ve got this beautiful new Toronto “Toile du Jouy” in the two rooms where we all spend so much time texting.

news.title: Nolan McD’s
news.body: Decision fatigue is depicted at its most delicious in this new McDonald’s spot from the lovely Nolan Sarner. It’s inviting and yummy, just like a box of McDonald’s french fries fresh out of the fryer. Are you hungry? Give it a [watch](https://www.instagram.com/p/DF8kwRQSajg/).

news.title: EyeCandy
news.body: The sharp eyes at EyeCandy @eyecannndy have spotted Jeremi Durand’s @_jeremidurand new music video for Nina Chuba @ninachuba. Surreal and simple, artful and wild we’re not surprised to see Jeremi’s work is turning heads. Check out the video here and the eye candy link [here](https://www.instagram.com/p/DFqY7qYS_Kj/?img_index=1).

news.title: ROM
news.body: In 1944, Robert “Bob” Hanf wrote this letter to his family from Auschwitz. At the time, all communication was censored so the outside world wouldn’t know what was really happening. In this film, light becomes a beacon of knowledge—passed from witness to witness, ensuring history is not forgotten and its mistakes are not repeated. “What will be the end?” Check out Jeremi Durand's new spot with the ROM [here.](https://www.instagram.com/reel/DHLyVQuOr1C/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link&igsh=MzRlODBiNWFlZA==)

news.title: Skin and Bones Jackets
news.body: If you know, you know. The 2017 jacket is back—now in red for our anniversary. Get it before it’s gone (again). Check it out on our instagram [here.](https://www.instagram.com/p/DHeSlKdSlgU/)

news.title: Liane's Birthday
news.body: Happy belated to the one keeping this production on schedule! Check it out on our instagram [here.](https://www.instagram.com/p/DHqzO1PuS6e/?img_index=1)
For anyone who’s ever walked in looking for Cozey, this one is for you. See [here](https://www.instagram.com/p/DHtzAMaPPKz/).

Rodney Lucas
news.body: Rodney Lucas knows a thing or two about good work. New stuff coming soon. See [here](https://www.instagram.com/p/DH_uf02Sqk-/?img_index=1)..
New work from Isaac for Steady Holiday. See [here](https://www.instagram.com/p/DICJ73nOKMT/).

Somewhere out there, Leo Zuckerman is [](https://www.instagram.com/leozuck/)framing up something special. New work incoming. See [here](https://www.instagram.com/p/DJcMhCMuw7H/?img_index=1).

Leo Zuckerman for Taylor Made Golf
